DOC.brief_summary: The aim study examine safety effectiveness 2 morphine delivery system post-surgical neonate . The investigator hypothesize study feasible conduct , neonates receive morphine via Parent/Nurse Controlled Analgesia pump receive less morphine experience few side effect neonates receive morphine via continuous opioid infusion .
DOC.brief_title: Parent/Nurse Controlled Analgesia Neonatal Intensive Care Unit
DOC.criteria: Surgery Location : Abdominal Thoracic First surgery Age : Born ≥ 3444 week postmenstrual age Weight : Weight birth current weight ≥2 kg Intubated extubated Prior opioid exposure : < 2 day continuous exposure history > 2 day continuous exposure , must continuous drip week Intermittent exposure ≤ 2 day prior surgery Neonates expose chronic opioids utero *In utero exposure Selective Seretonin Reuptake Inhibitors illicit drug screen annotate . At least 1 parent Englishspeaking Surgery Type : Cardiac , Patent Ductus Arteriosus Ligation ; Omphalocele ( intubate preoperatively ) Diagnoses : • Necrotizing Enterocolitis ; Diaphragmatic hernia ( unless thoracoscopically repair ) ; Chemically physiologically paralyze Receiving vasopressor Receiving acetaminophen benzodiazepine ( lorazepam midazolam ) ≤ 24 h surgery Patients follow : Epidural ; Oscillating ventilator
